;Recently, three Japanese political affairs officials and deputy ministers have died in explosions. A scandal broke out and he was forced to resign. A local opinion poll showed that after the scandal broke out, the approval rate of the cabinet led by Japanese Prime Minister Kishida Fumio fell to 21%, setting a new low since Kishida became prime minister in October 2021.

;

;The new cabinet was reorganized in September this year, and three people resigned in less than three months. For Fumio Kishida, he is currently facing a severe political crisis.

;

;"This is a period of unstable governance." Zhou Yongsheng, a professor at the Institute of International Relations at the China Foreign Affairs University, told Southern Weekend reporters that other factions within the party will also I'm ready to replace him.

;

;;

;

;On September 13, 2023 local time, in Tokyo, Japan, after the cabinet reshuffle, Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida attended a press conference in the Prime Minister's Office. ;(Visual China/Photo);

;

;Many senior officials were forced to resign

;

;Kanda Kenji, 60 years old, is a member of the House of Representatives of Japan's ruling Liberal Democratic Party.

;

;It was the Japanese "Bunshun Weekly" that first broke the scandal of the then Japanese Deputy Minister of Finance Kenji Kanda. According to reports, a company under his name defaulted on taxes, and between 2013 and 2022, the company's land and properties were seized by the tax department four times. The report also stated that as a tax accountant, Kanda Kenji himself violated relevant industry regulations and failed to participate in necessary training.

;

;Kanda apologized for the relevant scandal and admitted that the reports were true. Since he was "too busy to get involved" in overseeing the company's tax details, the work had been left to an accounting firm.

;

;After the scandal broke out, it triggered domestic public criticism of Kanda. Japan's opposition parties put pressure on the ruling party to remove him from office.

;

;On November 9, during his defense, Kanda also stated that he would "continue to perform his duties." However, on the 10th, he changed his words on whether to continue to perform his duties and said, "No." Comment". Resigned on the 13th.

;

;In just a few days, I changed my words three times.

;

;It is generally believed that Kenji Kanda was essentially replaced.

;

;In response to rising prices in Japan, Prime Minister Fumio Kishida proposed an economic countermeasure, an annual supplementary budget of over 17 trillion yen. Previously, the leader of the Cadet Party, Kenta Izumi, said that the Cadet Party would not participate in the deliberations on the budget unless Kishida replaced Kanda.

;

;On the day of his resignation, Kenji Kanda admitted that he resigned because he "did not want his scandal to affect the debate in Congress."

;

;This is not the first senior figure in Japanese politics to resign due to a scandal in recent times.

;

;On October 31, the then Deputy Minister of Justice Kakizawa Mitaru resigned due to suspicion of violating the Public Office Election Law.

;

;Kakizawa is a member of parliament elected from Koto Ward, Tokyo. Previously, Koto Ward Mayor Kimura Yayoi and her team were arrested by Tokyo for allegedly violating the public office election law. Search by the District Prosecutor's Office. Kakizawa admitted that he made suggestions to Kimura regarding illegal campaigning.

;

;It is worth noting that the scandals that broke out in Kanda and Kakizawa were due to tax evasion and other illegal issues, while Taro Yamada, then administrative officer of the Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology, was involved in "extramarital affairs". ".

;

;The 56-year-old Taro Yamada, who is married and has children, is also a senator of Japan's ruling Liberal Democratic Party.

;

;Just one month before Kanda resigned, on the evening of October 19, the media photographed Taro Yamada spending the night with a young woman in a hotel in Tokyo. , which lasts approximately three hours. After the news came to light, Taro Yamada admitted to having an extramarital affair and apologized, but denied paying the woman.

;

;Subsequently, the scope of negative public opinion spread wider and wider.

;

;On October 26, Taro Yamada resigned, becoming the first senior government official to resign after Kishida Fumio reorganized the cabinet.

;

;"Japanese politics have long been unclean." Zhou Yongsheng emphasized that the financial sector provides money to support politicians' campaigns, and once politicians gain power, they will Opening up the financial circle, formulating laws that are beneficial to them, and promoting policies that are beneficial to them, this is the collusion of money and power politics.

;

;Corruption scandals captured by the media as collusion between the financial and political circles are, in most cases, immediately exposed.

;

;Chou Yongsheng added that for those in power, this will make them disgraced, or their approval ratings will continue to decline. For them, the media is actually called the "fifth power constraint." Sometimes it is helpless, and sometimes it can be settled.

;

;On September 13, 2023, in order to save the sluggish support rate, Kishida reshuffled the cabinet again, replacing the existing 19-person list with 13 people, including the Foreign Minister , Defense Minister and other important positions, and declared that this is a "cabinet that transforms change into strength."

;

;Three members of the new cabinet, which was established less than three months ago, have resigned, but the public is not surprised.

;

;"The Japanese public is accustomed to scandals in the political world. Ordinary people have developed a 'political apathy' and do not pay much attention to the personal integrity and moral character of politicians. Great trust and expectations." Sun Wenzhu, associate researcher at the Asia-Pacific Institute of the China Institute of International Studies, said that the public does not approve of this open "fertile politics", but there is a lack of restraints.

;

;Disapproval rate hits record high

;

;"I must apologize to the Japanese people."

;

;On November 13, regarding Kanda’s dismissal due to tax arrears, Fumio Kishida publicly stated that he attaches great importance to the responsibility of appointment and will continue to do his best to perform his duties to restore the trust of the people.

;

;Many public opinions believe that the forced resignation of many senior executives was a "double blow" to Kishida.

;

;Affected by factors such as the domestic economic downturn, the push to discharge nuclear contaminated water into the sea, and the frequent scandals involving many ministers, the support rate of Kishida's cabinet continues to decline.

;

;On November 12, the results of a joint public opinion poll in Japan showed that the approval rate of the cabinet led by Kishida was 27.8%, a decrease of 7.8% from the October survey results. percentage points, setting a new low since the establishment of the Kishida cabinet in 2021. The disapproval rate reached 68.8%, a record high.

;

;Tang Qifang, associate researcher at the Institute of International Strategic Studies at the China Institute of International Studies, believes that the Japanese people are generally disappointed with the performance of politicians. There is a "domino" resignation effect this time. The people can be said to be "voting with their feet", and the cabinet's support rate will naturally decline.

;

;She added that, in fact, Abe’s support rate has been relatively low since the late period of his administration. It is not Kishida Fumio's personal deciding factor, this is also the "mess" left by his "predecessor". Kishida obviously failed to take over this stall, so it is a continuous decline process.

;

;In the Japanese political arena, "the cabinet support rate falls below 30%" is regarded as entering "dangerous waters"; once it falls further below 20%, it means The cabinet is not far away from being dissolved.

;

;Tang Qifang said that at the beginning, the Japanese people did not have particularly high expectations for Kishida Fumio, thinking that he might not be decisive or particularly innovative. Facts have also proved that many of Kishida Fumio’s ideas have not been translated into very practical policies.

;

;In the Liberal Democratic Party, Moriyama, the Liberal Democratic Party's general affairs chairman, publicly pointed out that the successive resignations of high-level officials were "an extremely abnormal situation."

;

;Moriyama leads the Moriyama faction, one of the smaller factions within the Liberal Democratic Party.

;

;Sun Wenzhu believes that the so-called "abnormality" is not only to maintain the authority of the Liberal Democratic Party as a whole, but also to be some kind of euphemistic accusation against Prime Minister Kishida Fumio, thus putting himself The Pai clan had a certain cut with Fumio Kishida.

;

;"This incident further exposed that money issues and style issues have become chronic diseases in Japanese politics." Sun Wenzhu said.

;

;Early this month, the Kishida cabinet launched an economic stimulus plan of over 17 trillion yen, the main content of which is tax cuts and extended subsidies. The Japanese government estimates that the plan will increase the Japanese economy by 1.2% annually over the next three years.

;

;But Kishida’s “spending money” failed to achieve the expected goals.

;

;On November 15, the Japanese Cabinet Office released third-quarter GDP data. Japan experienced negative quarterly GDP growth for the first time. In addition, Japan's private consumption declined in the third quarter, net exports fell by 0.1%, and corporate investment also declined.

;

;New economic strategies have not been recognized by the public.

;

;A Japanese poll shows that more than 60% of the people "disapprove" of the government's comprehensive economic countermeasures. The reason is that since 2020, Japan’s income tax and resident tax have increased year after year. The economic policies formulated by the Kishida cabinet today are not truly “beneficial to the people.”

;

;It turns out that prices in Japan have not risen for decades. Zhou Yongsheng pointed out, "Because Japan's imported goods are expensive, it promotes domestic inflation and causes prices to rise rapidly. The Japanese people cannot stand the sudden price increase, and they are skeptical of Kishida's ability to govern."

;

;What worries the public even more is that the Kishida cabinet has announced plans to significantly increase the defense budget between 2023 and 2027, with a total investment of up to 43 trillion yen. Many people are worried that the Kishida cabinet will use methods such as increasing taxes and misappropriating financial funds to revitalize earthquake-stricken areas to increase defense capabilities.

;

;Zhou Yongsheng believes that people's concerns are "not unreasonable." The biggest pressures Kishida's cabinet currently faces are pressures from domestic economic growth, financial constraints, and mounting debt. Japan's fiscal budget had to rely on the issuance of government bonds to expand its fiscal budget, causing its debt burden to become further heavy.

;

;"The financial flexibility of the Kishida cabinet is actually getting smaller and smaller, and coupled with the need to significantly expand armaments, the financial pressure is even greater. ." Zhou Yongsheng believes that armaments are purely a money-burning and money-consuming industry with no benefits.

;

;Sun Wenzhu believes that Fumio Kishida has been in office as president of the Liberal Democratic Party for two years, and the Liberal Democratic Party will usher in another presidential election in the fall of 2024 at the latest. Judging from the electoral strategy, it is likely that he will take the initiative to dissolve the House of Representatives before the intra-party election and lead the Liberal Democratic Party to win a majority in the House of Representatives to gain points for his re-election.

;

;Pressure of governing under the “yellow light”

;

;In the eyes of the outside world, reorganizing the cabinet cannot bring the Kishida regime back to life.

;

;"First of all, the current life of the Japanese people is in a state of instability, which directly affects people's livelihood and leads to a decline in support rates. This has a great influence on whether Kishida can continue to work in the future. Governance is a very big threat." Zhou Yongsheng said, "Secondly, Kishida has improperly hired officials in governance, and has hired corrupt people one after another. This is also a blow to his own image and the image of the cabinet."

;

;What is noteworthy is that this year, despite opposition from the international community, Japan insisted on discharging nuclear contaminated water from the Fukushima Daiichi Nuclear Power Plant into the sea, causing huge controversy at home and abroad.

;

;Sun Wenzhu pointed out that in terms of diplomacy, Japan is still essentially strengthening its all-round binding with the United States and relying on U.S. support to highlight its "sense of presence." What the Japanese people really need to improve Sino-Japanese relations has yet to see practical action.

;

;Many media reports said that if Kishida wants to be re-elected as president of the Liberal Democratic Party next fall and achieve long-term governance, he must choose the time to dissolve the House of Representatives and hold an election and ensure that the Liberal Democratic Party Achieved good results in the general election.

;

;However, the sluggish support rate of the cabinet, the sluggish support rate of the Liberal Democratic Party, and the reappearance of the "domino" of resignations of senior government officials have lit up a "yellow light" for Kishida's pursuit of long-term governance.

;

;However, according to many experts and scholars interviewed, this situation will not force Kishida to step down immediately.

;

;"Kishida Fumio's pressure is mainly on how to win next year's Liberal Democratic Party presidential election, and the possibility of dissolving the House of Representatives early to hold an election to continue to be in power." Sun Wenzhu said, Foreign Affairs The so-called "political achievements" mentioned above are of little practical significance to the Japanese people.

;

;Chou Yongsheng said that in the past, except for Abe and Koizumi, Japan’s cabinet changed almost every year. Kishida has been in power for two years now. If there are no major mistakes, he is likely to continue to be in power.

;

;Currently, Kishida has decided to abandon his plan to dissolve the House of Representatives within the year and go all out to promote the government's comprehensive economic countermeasures and strive to gradually boost public opinion.

;

;"There is a high probability that the Liberal Democratic Party will still maintain its position as the ruling party. With the split among factions within the party, it is difficult to produce a leader who can balance the interests of various factions, except Kishida. A candidate for president recognized by all factions," Sun Wenzhu believed.

;

;However, the Japanese people's disappointment in the political circles and their "apathy" towards politics are difficult to reverse.

;

;On November 10, 2023, the State Administration of Financial Supervision’s “Three Certainties” plan was implemented: Supervision of financial holding groups Functions and financial consumer rights protection responsibilities were officially transferred from the People's Bank of China to the State Administration of Financial Supervision. The People's Bank of China has taken another step toward a modern central bank system.

;

;Looking back on the past, 45 years ago, the People's Bank of China and the Ministry of Finance officially had separate offices, and began to exclusively perform the functions of the central bank in 1984. Since then, the central bank system has been continuously transformed and improved along with the pace of economic reform and social development.

;

;At the same time, the four major state-owned banks have transformed into leading benchmarks in the global banking industry, and smart finance has become the forefront of strategic competition.

;

;Internet finance, which was once full of chaos, has now been brought under the regulatory track and is growing into an innovative force in an orderly manner.

;

;As financial power becomes the new goal, how can the financial industry continue to change using history as a mirror?

;

;A researcher from Southern Weekend’s New Finance Research Center interviewed Li Dongrong, former deputy governor of the People’s Bank of China, for this purpose. In his nearly 40-year financial career, Li Dongrong served as deputy president of the Guangdong Branch of the People's Bank of China, deputy president of the ;Guangzhou; branch of the People's Bank of China, deputy director of the State Administration of Foreign Exchange, assistant to the president and deputy president of the People's Bank of China. . In June 2015, Li Dongrong was responsible for the establishment of the China Internet Finance Association and served as the first president for 7 years.

;

;In an exclusive interview with Southern Weekend, he described the fruitful results of China's financial reform and opening up as "thousands of sails passed by the side of the sinking boat, and thousands of spring trees in front of the diseased trees", but at the same time, he also described the effectiveness of my country's financial reform and opening up as "there is still a long way to go". The road ahead for financial reform is difficult.

;

;;

;

;Li Dongrong, former deputy governor of the People's Bank of China, former president of the China Internet Finance Association;(Photo provided by interviewee)< /span>;

;

;;Banks can’t just settle;;accounts;;be accountants;

;

;;Southern Weekend ：;;In your nearly 40-year financial career, what major financial reform and opening up events have you experienced or witnessed? ;

;

;;Li Dongrong:;;I was fortunate to participate in and witness some financial reform activities since the early 1980s, and participated in 5 national financial reforms since 1997. The Financial Work Conference has personally experienced and witnessed the financial reform and development in this historical stage, with banking system reform as the main feature. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;What was the importance of China’s financial system before reform and opening up? feature? Why is reform necessary? ;

;

;;Li Dongrong:;;For a long time before the reform and opening up, my country implemented a highly centralized planned economic system. Compatible with this are the unified fiscal revenue and expenditure and the unified bank deposits and loans. In 1969, the People's Bank of China and the Ministry of Finance jointly operated. The main characteristics of the country's financial system at that time were: the People's Bank of China was both a state agency that managed finance and a national bank that comprehensively operated banking services. The bank only handles working capital loans, with single business, centralized credit and small scale. ;

;

;On October 4, 1979, Comrade Deng Xiaoping pointed out at a symposium with the main leaders of the party committees of various provinces, autonomous regions and municipalities: Banks should focus on the economy. Now they are just settling accounts and acting as accountants, and they have not really played a role. to the role of the bank. Banks must become a lever for the development of economic innovation technology and truly become banks.

;

;Comrade Deng Xiaoping sharply outlined the main problems faced by my country's economy and finance at that time, timely pointed out the direction for my country's financial reform at the beginning of reform and opening up, and became an important guide for the reform of my country's financial system.

;

;;“Turn state-owned banks into real commercial banks”;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;How do you understand "turning a bank into a real bank"? ;

;

;;Li Dongrong: ;; It can be summarized into two main lines. One is to turn state-owned banks into real commercial banks; the other is to turn the People’s Bank of China into A true central bank. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;Why should we turn state-owned banks into real businesses? bank? ;

;

;;Li Dongrong:;;In the early days of reform and opening up, due to historical baggage and operational management issues, the four major state-owned professional banks generally faced unclear governance mechanisms. , unreasonable, high proportion of non-performing assets, increased interest receivable and uncollected and other outstanding problems. The Asian financial crisis in 1997 intensified the impact on the four major banks and highlighted the urgency of accelerating the reform of the state-owned banking system. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;While serving at the State Administration of Foreign Exchange and the People's Bank of China, You have gone through the process of transforming state-owned professional banks into commercial banks, especially pioneering moves such as using foreign exchange to inject capital into the four major banks. How were the difficulties overcome? ? ;

;

;;Li Dongrong:;;The State Council established a leading group for the joint-stock reform pilot work of wholly state-owned commercial banks. The office was located in the People's Bank of China. Zhou Xiaochuan, then president of the People's Bank of China, He served as the office director and Central Huijin Company was established at that time. In accordance with the arrangements of the Party Central Committee and the State Council, starting from December 2003, Central Huijin used its foreign exchange reserves to inject capital into the Bank of China and China Construction Bank respectively. After that, it injected capital into the Industrial and Commercial Bank of China and the Agricultural Bank of China respectively, and promoted their listing in mainland China and Hong Kong, gradually realizing the transformation of state-owned professional banks into joint-stock commercial banks. ;

;

;I was transferred to the State Administration of Foreign Exchange in early 2002. Under the leadership of the Party Committee of the People's Bank of China and the Party Group of the Administration of Foreign Exchange, the then Director Guo Shuqing led us to specifically participate in and witness the preparation for the establishment of Central Huijin and the launch of foreign exchange capital injection. During my participation, I was deeply proud of the correct decision-making of the Party Central Committee and the State Council and the effective implementation of the financial system. It was this series of important and timely decisions that laid an indispensable foundation for the Chinese banking system to get out of trouble and rise rapidly.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;How to fulfill the obligations of investors? ;

;

;;Li Dongrong:;;I remember that in order to truly fulfill the responsibilities and obligations of investors, on the one hand, we paid attention to strengthening the leadership of the party. Establish a party group to strengthen the construction of the party's grassroots organizations; on the other hand, actively organize learning, learn from the advanced experience of corporate governance in the international market, explore the establishment of a corporate governance mechanism in line with China's national conditions, and select comrades with excellent political and professional qualities from various units As a dispatched director, we provide prior training and education on politics, business and other aspects to enhance the dispatched directors’ ability to perform their duties. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;Since then, state-owned banks have continued to transform into commercial banks. You What do you think are the key factors? ;

;

;;Li Dongrong:;;Looking back, the success of the shareholding reform of my country’s wholly state-owned commercial banks is fundamentally based on two points: First, persistence The party’s leadership in the reform and development of the financial industry; second, establishing a market operating mechanism based on national conditions. The Party Central Committee and the State Council are far-sighted, assess the situation and make correct decisions, and the People's Bank of China specifically organizes and implements the joint-stock reform of wholly state-owned commercial banks. The establishment of Central Huijin Corporation, especially the creative use of national foreign exchange reserves to inject capital into pilot banks, promoted the final completion of the shareholding reform and listing of wholly state-owned commercial banks, and successfully solved the problems of unreasonable mechanisms and historical burdens of wholly state-owned commercial banks, allowing for transformation The later state-owned banks were revitalized and became real commercial banks. ;

;

;Historical practice shows that China’s banking system is now of considerable scale in terms of institutions, total deposits and loans, and fund settlement volume, with relatively rich types of products and services, and excellent service means. The trend of intelligence has better supported the development of the real economy and served people's living needs.

;

;";The People's Bank of China becomes;;a real central bank;"

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;You just mentioned that another main line of financial reform is to turn the People's Bank of China into a real central bank. How did you recognize and witness the transformation of human life? Is there anything particularly impressive? ;

;

;;Li Dongrong:;;In order to adapt to the new situation faced after the reform and opening up, do a good job in stabilizing the currency value and supporting healthy economic development, the country has accelerated the improvement of the central government's The pace of banking system reform. In 1978, the central government decided to separate the People's Bank of China from the Ministry of Finance and take charge of national financial management. Since then, the People's Bank of China's system has been reforming. Until December 25, 1993, the State Council issued a decision on the reform of the financial system and pointed out that turning the People's Bank of China into a true central bank was the primary task of deepening the reform of the financial system. ;

;

;At that time, I was working at the Guangdong Branch of the People’s Bank of China. From June 20 to June 26, 1991, experts and scholars from the People's Bank of China, various professional banks, other financial institutions, relevant legal departments, financial circles and legal circles gathered in Zhuhai to solicit opinions and opinions from all aspects on the drafting of the Banking Law. suggestion. In 1995, the versions reviewed and approved by the Standing Committee of the National People's Congress were divided into the People's Bank of China Law and the Commercial Bank Law. They more objectively and accurately reflect the direction and current situation of my country's banking system reform.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;As the country clearly defines the functions of the People’s Bank of China as the central bank, the People’s Bank of China How to deepen and improve functional positioning? ;

;

;;Li Dongrong:;;As the functional positioning becomes increasingly clear, the People’s Bank of China has timely adjusted its credit fund management system, appropriately used monetary policy tools for macro-control, and continuously optimized and enriched the system. Monetary Policy Toolbox. The credit fund management system was changed from the original unified deposit and unified loan to the balance contract, and soon transitioned to "unified planning, divided funds, actual loans and deposits, and mutual accommodation", thereby realizing the shift from direct management of credit funds to indirect management. The change of ownership laid the foundation for the subsequent macro-control model of asset-liability ratio management. ;

;

;In November 1997, the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and the State Council held the first national financial work conference, which determined the policy of further deepening the reform of the financial system and emphasized that the People's Bank of China should be transformed into a truly central bank. Banks fully embody the three characteristics of the issuing bank, the bank's bank and the country's bank.

;

;The People's Bank of China subsequently separated its financial regulatory functions and established the China Securities Regulatory Commission, the China Insurance Regulatory Commission, and the China Banking Regulatory Commission to focus on formulating and implementing monetary and macro-prudential policies and maintaining financial stability.

;

;Reform continues. In 2023, according to the State Council's institutional reform plan, the People's Bank of China's daily supervision responsibilities for financial holding companies and other financial groups and related financial consumer protection responsibilities will be transferred to the State Financial Supervision and Administration Bureau; the relevant functions of the People's Bank of China's county (city) branches will be transferred to China Prefecture (city) central branch of the People's Bank of China. This reflects the direction and measures to further accelerate the construction of China's modern central bank system in the new historical period.

;

;;Science;;Technology is an important driving force for reform;;;;;

;

; ;Southern Weekend:;;You just mentioned that the service methods of China’s banking system are showing a trend of intelligence. In recent years, it has become a consensus that there is no finance without technology. As a deputy governor of the central bank who was once in charge of the science and technology department, what role do you think technology has played in the reform of the financial system so far? ;

;

;;Li Dongrong:;;Looking back on the 45 years of China’s financial reform and opening up, it has been 45 years of accompanying global technological progress and keeping up with the pace of technological progress. It can be said that it is the important driving force of science and technology that enables my country's financial system represented by banks to continuously adapt to the reform and development of the economy and provide the society with more adaptable and effective financial services. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;In the early days of reform and opening up, are you interested in applying financial technology? At this stage, what are the characteristics of China’s financial technology? ;

;

;;Li Dongrong:;;As early as the mid-1980s, the People's Bank of China took the lead in establishing a leading group for the electronicization of the financial system and established the "Sixth Five-Year Plan" Make preparations, lay the foundation in the Seventh Five-Year Plan, increase the scale in the Eighth Five-Year Plan, and basically achieve the overall goal of electronics in the Ninth Five-Year Plan. ;

;

;At this stage, the financial industry mainly relies on scientific and technological means such as computer technology and network technology to improve the efficiency of traditional financial services and reduce operating costs. One is electronic operation. The second is system networking. The third is standardization. Bank cards are a successful example of unified standards.

;

;Benefiting from reform and opening up and technological progress, my country's financial electronic construction has achieved a historic breakthrough of "from scratch, from manual to electronic, from stand-alone to networked".

;

;Under the guidance of top-level design, my country’s financial informatization construction has begun to enter the fast lane. Financial informatization and financial standardization are also closely linked to international financial regulatory cooperation. I have been fortunate enough to participate in and witness many major informatization events in the financial industry.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;Which incident impressed you the most? ;

;

;;Li Dongrong:;;The application and promotion of financial IC cards. ;

;

;With the increase in the amount of funds managed by bank cards and the continuous development of information technology, magnetic stripe cards have gradually become an attack target for criminals due to their weaknesses such as lack of computing power and easy information copying. object. Technical experiments and global practical experience show that after the UK, France and other countries and regions completed the migration of financial IC cards, the risk of bank card fraud has dropped significantly. On the contrary, those countries and regions that have not carried out the migration of financial IC cards in a timely manner may become a depression for global bank card security.

;

;With the rapid development of my country's bank card industry and the completion of the migration of financial IC cards in neighboring countries and regions, some counterfeit card fraud activities have gradually penetrated into my country. Accelerating the application of financial IC cards has become a top priority to improve my country's bank card risk prevention and control levels and ensure people's payment safety.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;Looking back at the application and promotion of financial IC cards, you What is your greatest experience? ;

;

;;Li Dongrong:;;Looking back on this arduous journey, I deeply realize that the significance of the promotion and application of financial IC cards is not only from the perspective of security protection. From this perspective, it reduces the losses caused by counterfeit card fraud, protects people's wallets, and plays an important role in promoting the development of mobile finance, inclusive finance and green finance, as well as promoting the upgrading of the domestic industrial chain. ;

;

;On the one hand, it lays the foundation for improving the availability and convenience of financial services for the people; on the other hand, the People's Bank of China has also been actively supporting my country's technologies and products with independent intellectual property rights. . For example, we can build experimental environments and pilots to verify the application of national encryption algorithms on financial IC cards. This provides application scenarios and contributes to technological development and progress in key domestic fields.

;

;;Regulation;;Mutual Finance;;Risk;;At the same time promote bank digitalization;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;Internet finance has grown wildly, but it also represents a trend. What do you think about participating in the special rectification work on Internet financial risks? ;

;

;;Li Dongrong:;;In 2015, with the consent of the Party Central Committee and the State Council, ten ministries and commissions including the People's Bank of China issued the "Guidance on Promoting the Healthy Development of Internet Finance" Opinion". The document clarifies the need to strengthen self-discipline in the Internet finance industry, requiring the People's Bank of China to work with relevant departments to establish the China Internet Finance Association and give full play to the positive role of the industry's self-discipline mechanism in regulating the market behavior of practitioners and protecting the legitimate rights and interests of the industry. ;

;

;I accepted the organizational arrangement and was responsible for the preparation of the China Internet Finance Association and participated in the special rectification of Internet financial risks. I witnessed the process of the industry from chaos, rectification to standardized development.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;As an industry self-regulatory organization,: China Internet Finance Association regulates Internet finance What are the main principles? ;

;

;;Li Dongrong:;;In April 2016, the State Council issued the "Implementation Plan for Special Rectification of Internet Financial Risks", which was jointly rectified by the People's Bank of China and other 17 ministries and commissions Illegal and irregular behaviors in the field of Internet finance and promote the standardized and orderly development of Internet finance. Since its establishment, the Internet Finance Association has invested in special risk rectification work in accordance with the arrangements of the State Council and the People's Bank of China. ;

;

;Since 2016, the state has actively promoted the digital transformation of banks while organizing and carrying out special rectification of risks in the Internet financial industry and guiding the standardized development of the industry. As an industry self-regulatory organization, the association mainly works in four aspects to establish self-discipline.

;

;First, strengthen the construction of basic systems and self-discipline rules. By establishing business systems and system platforms such as statistical monitoring, reporting, registration disclosure, information sharing, and financial advertising monitoring, we provide basic services for the industry to unify standards, standardize operations, and prevent risks, and also provide timely notification and relevant information to central and local financial regulatory authorities. Monitoring information.

;

;The second is to formulate and promote the implementation of relevant standard rules. Taking the prevention of Internet financial risks and financial consumer protection as the starting point, we will promote the implementation of regulatory policies and ensure the implementation of policies through standard rules.

;

;The third is to carry out statistical monitoring and risk warning. Cooperate with the National Bureau of Statistics to promote the implementation of relevant statistical systems, cooperate with financial regulatory authorities to continuously monitor relevant risk areas, grasp the risk base, and publish risks on virtual currencies, cash loans, initial coin offerings (ICOs), illegal or illegal financial advertising and other activities Early warning reminder.

;

;The fourth is to cooperate with the country in carrying out infrastructure construction in the financial industry. In accordance with the overall plan and regulatory requirements for the development of the national credit reporting market, the association organized all participating units to prepare at all stages, and in February 2018, they obtained the country's first commercial institution license to carry out personal credit reporting business, and went public for business in the same year. . This provides a new channel for various financial institutions to conduct personal credit inquiries.

;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;After the Internet financial risks are gradually cleared, the financial industry, which is accelerating digital transformation, should What risks are guarded against? ;

;

During this period, the concealment, suddenness and diffusion of risks will become more prominent, thus posing more new challenges to modern financial supervision and social stability. ;

;

;The digital transformation of my country's banks is showing a rapid development trend, as shown in the following: First, technology-driven development is more prominent. Second, demand leadership is more common. Third, industry integration is closer. Fourth, risk management is more urgent. Therefore, in the process of transformation of the banking industry, on the one hand, it must actively face and embrace the opportunities and challenges brought by the application of new technologies, and at the same time, it must establish a stronger awareness of risk prevention and strengthen safety construction.

Looking back on the past, I have four profound insights: First, we must always adhere to the leadership of the party and use correct ideological principles to guide financial reform and opening up. ;

;Argentina’s general election was announced, and Javier Millay, the candidate of the right-wing electoral alliance “Freedom Forward Party” won, the news out, domestic critics generally looked down upon it. Argentina has slipped from developed countries and is stuck in the quagmire of populism, inflation and poverty. The president elected now advocates shutting down many government ministries, privatizing prisons, blowing up the central bank... Are the Argentine people crazy?

;

;Foreign political and economic circles are not so pessimistic. After Milais was elected, governments from all over the world expressed congratulations. Former US President Trump (Millais is often regarded as "Argentina's Trump") said that he would make Argentina great again. Musk was more direct: Argentina’s prosperity is coming. The Argentine stock market soared by more than 22% that day. In addition to domestic investors, foreign investors were also very excited. Millay's election as president of Argentina was seen by many as an opportunity.

;

;The domestic media’s introduction of Milai is not a distortion. Those sensational statements do belong to Milai. The expectations of the bullish are also serious. Compared with previous Argentine presidents, Milai is refreshing and is regarded as the most important force for change in Argentina in recent years, and this change does not necessarily lead to disaster. To understand this requires a deep understanding of Millais himself and his philosophy.

;

;Millais is a follower of Rothbard

;

;Millais came from a commoner class. His mother was a housewife and his father was a bus driver. He majored in economics in college and has been making a living doing it ever since. He has taught at universities, consulted for companies, worked as an economist at HSBC Bank, and worked in international organizations... Compared to academics in the academy, Millais has richer experiences. In the era of social media, Milai made sharp comments, laughed and cursed online, gaining a large number of fans and becoming a famous Internet celebrity economist in Argentina.

;

;In 2019, Millais officially entered the political arena. He joined the "Liberal Party" founded by his supporters as a political amateur, served as the party chairman, and integrated with another right-wing political party to form the influential "Liberal Party" Freedom Forward Party". In 2021, Milley was elected to the House of Representatives. In 2023, he ran for president and succeeded in one fell swoop. Millais accumulated energy on the Internet, which is certainly an important reason for his success; but his real source of power is his political and economic ideas.

;

;Millais is a believer in the Austrian School of Economics - an economic school tasked with defending the free market that originated in the Austro-Hungarian Empire in the 19th century. The Austrian School continued to develop through debates with various interventionist ideas. Its representative figures were the economist Mises and later Rothbard. Rothbard inherited Mises's economics, also developed libertarian theory, and participated in the founding of the Liberal Party, the third largest political party in the United States today. Millais's spiritual mentor was Rothbard.

;

;Millais once said that after reading "Man, the Economy, and the State" (Rothbard's most important economics work), he deeply realized that the economics knowledge he learned in college was all problematic. The root cause of Argentina's long-term disaster is that the entire country is shrouded in a haze of interventionism. The previous Peronism and the subsequent Kirchnerism were nothing more than a mixture of populism, trade protectionism, Keynesianism, welfarism and other ideas. These ideas bring about endless inflation, monopoly and scarcity.

;

;Using the Austrian School as his ideological weapon, Millais has been criticizing domestic economic policies all year round and attracting public attention. This is his duty as an economist. As a true disciple of Rothbard, it is not surprising that Millais sided with absolute individual rights.

;

;During this election campaign, Milley had no intention of concealing his true views when talking about controversial topics (and there was no way to hide it, as he has been known as a loudmouth online for many years). This may be his campaign strategy: to create an outspoken persona and gain more attention. Spread political opinions amidst controversy and build your own base. Trump has also used this strategy. Campaigning is a stage show, governing is another matter. Milley's real focus is the economy.

;

;Thirteen-point policy plan

;

;In August 2023, Argentina launched the primary election for the general election, and Milais submitted a policy plan including thirteen measures. Almost all of these measures are related to the economy.

;

;The first measure is to significantly reduce Argentina’s 18 ministries and commissions, retaining 8 ministries and commissions including interior affairs, foreign affairs, national defense, economy, justice, security, infrastructure, and human resources. As crazy as it sounds, the reality is that Argentina is currently experiencing economic difficulties, with a large number of departments nearly paralyzed and employees idle. The reform is not about cutting it off, but about stopping new recruitment and not laying off employees in the short term, but about redistributing personnel. Retainers are not subject to renewal unless privileged services (such as bodyguards and drivers) are withdrawn due to absolute necessity.

;

;The measure also includes a plan to privatize state-owned enterprises - by selling state-owned assets to fill the government's shortfall and compensate laid-off workers. It doesn't seem too outrageous upon closer inspection. The remaining dozen measures include: cutting public expenditures and reducing fiscal deficits; flexibilizing labor laws to reduce employment costs for enterprises; implementing unilateral free trade and canceling import tariffs; canceling the central bank and dollarizing the Argentine peso; implementing energy reforms and reducing investment in new products. Energy subsidies; attracting long-term foreign investment; abolishing exchange rate and export quota controls...

;

;Each measure is remarkable and has the same direction: reducing government controls and increasing market vitality. The core and most controversial aspect here is monetary policy. "Blowing up the central bank" and using US dollars has left many scholars, especially the domestic public, stunned. How can a sovereign country not have its own central bank? Those who are surprised do not realize that in the monetary systems of various countries, in addition to the central bank system where the country independently issues currency, there is also a currency board system.

;

;The currency board system means that the domestic currency establishes an anchor relationship with the currencies of other countries based on foreign exchange reserves, and the private sector can exchange it at any time at a fixed rate. The national currency becomes the token that anchors the currency. This system has its drawbacks - for example, if a country's currency is tied to the US dollar, it has to bear the cost of US dollar inflation. The advantages are also obvious: it restricts the government's power to print money and protects the economy from domestic inflation; if the government wants to have sufficient foreign exchange reserves, it must live within its means and cannot engage in large-scale deficit finance.

;

;In the 1990s, Argentina also implemented a currency board system, and the inflation rate once dropped to less than 5%. However, the government continued to spend extravagantly, leading to financial collapse. In 2002, the country restarted its central bank and once again launched a currency flood. Today's Argentina is a country with extremely serious inflation. The annual inflation rate reaches more than double digits, and the monetary system must be restarted every few decades. In 2022, Argentina’s inflation rate will exceed 140%. Under such a monetary system, the banknotes in the hands of the people become useless paper every once in a while, so how can they save and invest? Launching a new binding regime became an acceptable option.

;

;To switch the currency system, we must talk about technical solutions. Argentina’s foreign exchange reserves are about 30 billion US dollars, its foreign debt is nearly 300 billion US dollars, and the people have almost no US dollars in their hands. How can we talk about dollarization? Milley's plan is to sell state-owned assets, introduce foreign investment, fill the debt deficit, and accumulate foreign exchange reserves; suspend the issuance of national currency, allow the circulation of U.S. dollars, and drive out bad currency with market-oriented good currency to form a real exchange rate. After the market stabilizes, the official government's official exchange rate between the Argentine peso and the US dollar will form an anchor - this is the general framework of the currency board system.

;

;Argentina is a medium-sized country with a population of 46 million, but it allows the US dollar to circulate within the country and its own currency becomes a vassal? It's hard for many people to understand. But the fact is that dollarization is not unacceptable in some countries where governance has failed. Panama, Ecuador and El Salvador in Latin America all use the US dollar. Venezuela and the United States are sworn enemies. The country’s currency, the Bolivar, has been inflated several times and has become nothing more than useless paper. The public uses U.S. dollars for transactions widely. The government has no choice but to accept the status quo, effectively giving up its monetary sovereignty.

;

;Inflation is the crux of Argentina's economic ills. The government issues excessive amounts of money, spends excessively, and distributes welfare benefits indiscriminately, fueling a populist trend. Argentina has difficulty obtaining international aid, and foreign investment is unwilling to go there. The entire country is starving for food. Only by tightening the monetary gate can there be real economic reform. “Blowing up the central bank” sounds crazy, but it’s actually not outrageous. Can the scoffers offer a better solution? At least in the current Argentine political arena, Milley's thinking is the clearest.

;

;Can Mi Lai succeed?

;

;In other areas, Millais also has solutions. The free market is the principle direction and compromise is the solution. Some people criticize Milais for compromising, but I don't take it seriously. Millais at this time was not an economist, but a politician. Regardless of whether you are tough or compromise, you have to adjust according to the current situation. A slow, incremental reform is better than a rapid miscarriage.

;

;In the next few years, Argentina’s civil servants, state-owned enterprises and public service system, in order to keep their iron rice bowl, will surely stand up to obstruct the reform; people whose interests have been harmed in the economy will also join the ranks of opposition. Argentina is surrounded by mostly left-wing countries, and they are powerful supporters of Millais opponents. If reforms are vigorously promoted in various fields, Argentina is bound to be in a state of upheaval. Does Milai have such trading skills?

;

;Reform requires progress, and economic growth also takes time. Even if Milley does everything right, he himself is likely to step down quickly. The "Freedom Forward Party" has no significant advantage during the election and needs to form alliances with other parties to govern. Milley's own base is not solid, and it is questionable whether he can win over enough supporters in five years. Argentina has a tradition of military coups. Will the military take advantage of the chaos to oust him? These are issues that transcend economics.

;

;Ever since Millais entered politics, it has been destined that he cannot be just a scholar. He needs to become a politician and even a strongman to put Argentina on the track of development. The 21st century is no longer the era of strong men, and Milai is no longer Pinochet. It is worth observing how far Argentina's reforms can go. Argentina is a model for middle-class countries, and its success or failure in reform will have an exemplary impact on Latin America and even more countries.

;

;Finally, let’s discuss a topic: In a country like Argentina with a strong left-wing atmosphere for a long time, why can a weirdo like Milai come to power? His outstanding abilities are certainly very important in the social media era. The brewing of social ideological trends is also an important factor.

;

;After World War II, Argentina’s economy stagnated for a long time under the rule of Peronism. Various interventionism took turns, but the economy did not improve. The brief economic bright spot during this period was the liberalization reforms in the early 1990s. Entering the new century, Argentina entered the Kirchner era. Economically, it continued Peronist control habits, and the economy was sluggish for a long time. Politically, the Kirchners took turns in power for more than ten years. In this dull atmosphere, Milai, a political amateur, brought an innovative atmosphere and made people shine.

;

;In addition, Argentina’s foundation of free thought cannot be ignored. In 1959, Mises, the master figure of the Austrian School, visited Argentina and delivered many speeches, which planted the seeds of free thought in contemporary Argentine academic circles. The Austrian school is not considered mainstream in the international economics community, but it is very active in Argentina. There are elements of economist communication, and the ubiquitous regulations in Argentina often resonate with listeners. Millay's popularity among young people in Argentina is no accident.

;

;Argentina also has its own roots in liberal thought. In the 19th century, a group of politicians who believed in classical liberalism emerged in Argentina. Political thinker Juan Alverdi was a diplomat. He absorbed advanced ideas from Europe and returned to his country to lead the formulation of the constitution, explaining that Argentina should be founded on immigration and trade and integrate into the global market. Sarmiento was the first civilian president. He abolished the hierarchical system left by European colonists and advocated transforming the country through free trade and urbanization.

;

;Similar thinkers were not uncommon in early Argentina. The country's ability to enter the ranks of developed countries in the early 20th century was the result of generations of forefathers, who enjoyed high prestige in the minds of their own people. Millais was well versed in economic history. He exploited the classical liberal resources of his nation, cited classics, and occupied the moral high ground.

;

;After the election victory, Milai once again called for embracing Alvedi, returning to the concept of limited government, and restoring the glory that the nation should have. "Make Argentina great again" is not just a copycat, but what many Argentines really think. At any time, nationalism is a banner with appeal. The key depends on where it points.

;
;

;

;Tang Xiaofeng: "What is Historical Geography", Beijing Sanlian Bookstore, September 2023

;

;
;

;

;Based on his profound knowledge and sharp eyesight, the author focuses on specific and unique Commentary method is used to tell the history of the formation and development of this subject branch; (more than two-fifths of the book, but not too much) ;. From the perspective of "raising questions is more important than solving them", he summarized a number of enlightening problem areas arising from the development of this field following the path of modern geography. The whole book uses a narrative method that is completely different from that of textbooks, painting a vivid intellectual portrait of historical geography on the page.

;

;This book is written very emotionally, so it can easily shorten the distance with ordinary readers. Witnessing Hou Renzhi taking out a few soil samples from the archaeological ash pit and taking them away, the author "suddenly felt that something called science suddenly appeared." He used Zhang Chengzhi's words, "If I had read this book earlier, I would have taken the postgraduate entrance exam for him" to recreate the academic impact of Shi Nianhai's "Collection of Rivers and Mountains". He pointed out how important it is for Chinese historical geography to be recognized by Tan Qixiang, who has the trust of first-class academic scholars in the field of historical documents. He also said that Skinner's assertion that traditional China had "no nationwide urban system" first made him "stunned", but then, "of course I immediately realized that Skinner was talking about economics, not politics."

;

;I have always thought that the emergence of the Yugong School from the field of ancient history analysis meant the formation of modern historical geography in China. However, this book regards it as just a "transitional state" and takes the emergence of the "new paradigm with geography as its ontology" in the 1950s as a sign of the "creation" of this branch of the discipline. This understanding, including whether historical geography has really been "geographicalized" today, and whether it should be "geographicalized" across the board, still deserves further discussion. The "geographicalization" of historical geography and the "humanities" of geography may reflect the increasingly multidisciplinary nature of modern scholarship.

;

;If you ask, is there anyone in contemporary academia who maintains the magnanimous, elegant, and gentle academic gentlemanly demeanor? The first thing I think of is Tang Xiaofeng. This book deepened my impression. Professor Munro Shida asked, and I also claimed a topic in the "What is..." series of Ledo Library, but I always felt that I couldn't write it. After reading this book, I finally feel a little confident.

;

;;

;

;
;;

;Peter Singer: "The Important Things in Life: 72 Lessons in Ethics", translated into Chinese by Wang Xin, Guangxi Normal University Press, April 2023

;

;Limit value rational judgment exclusively to the scope of demonstration of the legitimacy of moral intentions, and rely entirely on instrumental rationality to "scientifically" achieve the above Intention, doing so is likely to blur our ethical horizons. The more prosperous science becomes, the more society needs ethics.

;

;This book is a collection of short comments published by the author in newspaper columns over the years. "The limit of one thousand words" forced him "to write in a clear and concise style." What it focuses on are the confusions or dilemmas that ordinary people face in their daily lives in contemporary society: Is morality progressing? What is a good life? When should charity be shown to someone who has made a mistake? If narcotics are recognized to shorten lifespan, should they still be used to suppress pain? Should we live a thousand years? Can public figures have a private life? Is open diplomacy possible? Some readers may feel that the author has not provided any "substantive conclusions" on questions such as this. That may be precisely because we are too familiar with another way of discussion, which can give a decisive and only correct answer to any question.

;

;A book that talks about ethics to the public can be written without looking like a boring sermon with a straight face. Our skills in this area are far from perfect. However, the subtitle of the translation still evokes the feeling of sitting upright between the narrow desks and chairs. It would be better to literally translate the title of the book as "Ethics in the Real World: 72 Short Essays Related to It", which may be more in line with the purpose of the original book.

;

;;

;

;
;;

;Li Tiangang: "Memory of the Ages: The Shaping of Modern Chinese Ideology", Renmin University of China Press, July 2023

; < p style="text-align: left;">;The earliest article I read included in this collection was "1900: The Restless South." I remember that I called Brother Tiangang very excitedly at that time, hoping that he would write a few more articles on this "Centennial Commemoration", and that when they were accumulated, they could be compiled and published. But meaningful "hundred years" are rare, and there are still some that are inconvenient to write about. The "Reminiscence of the Year" compiled before my eyes can be regarded as a common one.

;

;Compared with many other books on similar topics, how can this book uncover so many new insights worthy of our deep thought? The key is whether you start from a bunch of ready-made presuppositions and pretend to interpret history, or do you go back to the scene and examine it from scratch? In fact, we cannot return to the historical scene. However, as long as you are willing, you can still "see" that period of history as empathetically as possible through the various records left by people at that time. "The devil is in the details." To give an example that is not included in this book: Wang Kaiyun recalled the "painful history" of the burning of the Old Summer Palace. Why did he call that fire "Lishan Fire"? Not all ignored details are so important, but some solid and reliable details can really become "devils" that change established perceptions!

;

;Another century-old elegy in the book is "1905: The Disillusionment of the Imperial Examination System". The abolition of the imperial examination not only broke the backbone of traditional Chinese society, but also allowed "dispersed scholar-bureaucrats to pervasively penetrate into all strata of society, exacerbating the turmoil across the country." The author has the same view as Professor Yang Guoqiang, who strongly emphasizes that modern Chinese society suffered from "tenon removal".

;

;;

;

;
;< /p>;

;Li Jianming: "The Mainstream of Political Culture during the Founding of the United States", The Commercial Press, July 2023

;

;Americans are brave enough to open up a "noisy" discussion on how to view the system of their country's founding. In this regard, the author of this book uses more than a thousand pages to develop a response and rethinking full of ideological tension based on his own life experience. There are not enough people to comment on "Douban Reading", but the readers who left short comments all gave five stars.

;

;The so-called "mainstream" must have received countless tributaries along both sides of the river, making the water mixed with mud and sand; but it must also form the same giant current rushing forward. . During the American Revolution, the power elite and the radical masses distrusted each other and struggled with each other, even causing turmoil and rebellion in local society. Different from many self-proclaimed political science studies that always try to explain political struggles in terms of power, selfish desires and the pursuit of maximizing interests, and regard the pursuit of values ​​as just a fig leaf for seizing power and maximizing interests, the author emphasizes that it is the two sides’ mutual opposition to The common belief in popular sovereignty and republican principles prevented the American Revolution from becoming a story of a life-and-death struggle between good and evil, but instead became a witness to the initial establishment of modern democracy.

;

;Chapter 5 "Reconstruction of the Concept of 'Democracy'" is particularly worthy of careful reading. The British Revolution promoted constitutionalism but did not talk about democracy. Therefore, Americans need to rediscover the value of democracy as "a dangerous and even insulting label." This reminds me of Xu Fuguan’s opinion about the people’s “foolishness but spirituality”: “From the perspective of the knowledge level of intellectuals, the people are foolish. But in terms of their ability to judge big rights and wrongs, good and bad, the people are superior to intellectuals.… Therefore, Confucianism believes that people’s likes and dislikes derived from judgments of right and wrong can be trusted."

;

;;< /p>;

;Shao Xiaofeng: "Song Style Artistic Life", Shanghai Literature and Art Publishing House, September 2023

;

;After China emerged from the "medieval era" during the Tang and Song Dynasties, did it enter its "pre-modern era"? Experts have mixed opinions on this. But they may all agree that the Song Dynasty, especially the Southern Song Dynasty, is a not-too-distant past that ordinary Chinese can directly perceive based on their real-life experience.

;

;The topic selection of this book is therefore very down-to-earth, the writing is relaxed but not frivolous, and it is profound but not esoteric. It is not about the art of the Song Dynasty itself, but the Song people's taste in art and their art of life, that is, the artistic orientation and aesthetic taste contained in daily life shared by many social strata at that time. The whole book uses seven theme words to connect fifty essays, focusing on the small and big things. Although it cannot be said that it has achieved the effect of "gathering armpits into fur", it is not too much to say that it uses auspicious light feathers of different colors to connect a picture of the night sky.
