;Online micro-series, usually a single episode lasts from tens of seconds to about 15 minutes, and the number of episodes ranges from a dozen to hundreds of episodes, mainly including Short dramas on long video platforms mainly based on Youku, iQiyi, Mango, Tencent, etc., short dramas on short video platforms mainly on Douyin, Kuaishou, etc., and "mini program short dramas" that are "parasitic" on WeChat and others.

;

;;

;

;Part of the cover of Douyin short drama. Data map

;

;Detawen's "Micro Short Drama Market Report for the First Half of 2023" shows that in the first half of 2023, a total of 481 new micro short dramas will be released, which has exceeded The number of new releases in 2022 (454). On November 22, the "2023-2024 China Micro-Short Drama Market Research Report" released by iiMedia Consulting showed that China's online micro-short drama market size will be 37.39 billion yuan in 2023, a year-on-year increase of 267.65%. Overseas, according to media reports, ReelShort, a short drama application platform owned by Chinese Online, has topped the U.S. iOS entertainment list.

;

;What supports the new trend of short dramas is the huge number of viewers. The "China Online Audiovisual Development Research Report (2023)" shows that as of December 2022, the number of short video users in China has reached 1.012 billion, of which more than half of the short video users have watched micro-short dramas and instant noodles that are less than 3 minutes in length. etc., the viewing proportion of users aged 19 and under exceeds 50%. In August 2023, data released by Kuaishou also showed that the number of people interested in short dramas on Kuaishou exceeded 260 million.

;

;In just one or two hours, the audience traveled through the various fun spots that were set, experiencing rebirth, sudden wealth, and reverse. Attack, slap in the face, revenge and other various virtual lives. In this short drama world, they can easily gain a perfect love and reach the other side of success effortlessly.

;

;“What is needed is simplicity, speed and directness”

;

;Qiao Wei used to play otome games (note: those targeting women Dating simulation game), I watched the short drama in August. She is 39 years old and works as a training supervisor in a company. The first short drama she watched was a clip automatically recommended by a short video platform. The plot was simple: the heroine had to find someone to get married because of various grievances between wealthy families. She mistakenly thought that the male protagonist was the president at the construction site. He was an ordinary worker. After marrying him, the two started a life of marriage first and love later.

;

;Qiao Wei watched it for more than a minute. Her first impression was of handsome men and beautiful women. She thought the theme of "The Domineering President Falls in Love with Me" was interesting. After searching for the full collection Then they gave chase. To her surprise, the short drama had a compact plot and no unnecessary plot. She finished it in just over an hour. After that, she started looking for short dramas recommended by other netizens.

;

;During a busy working day, Qiao Wei only has lunch break and two hours before going to bed. For her, the length of short dramas is just right. Even if there are more than a hundred episodes of short dramas, it only takes an hour or two to finish them all. During her lunch break, she would randomly open a movie and watch a dozen or twenty episodes, which lasted only about twenty minutes, as a pastime. "Anyway, my time is fragmented."

;

;The scene of Tan Zhifeng watching the short play is also similar. She is completing her third year of master's degree this year and will watch short dramas in her spare time. However, she usually doesn't go out of her way to find short dramas recommended by others. She just watches the ones that appeal to her. She would even watch short dramas at double speed. "The main reason is that she doesn't have enough time and is anxious, so she wants to finish it as soon as possible." Moreover, "each scene of the short drama does not contain such complicated information," so double speed does not affect it.

;

;According to her observation, short dramas generally rely on dialogue between actors to advance the plot. The president may sit on a chair and communicate with the butler next to him. Once the matter is done, "you can move on to the next step." There are not so many details to explore in the short play, such as what traditional elements the set is designed according to, and what information is conveyed by the actors' movements and eyes.

;

;Tan Zhifeng used to read online articles for more than ten years. When she first saw some clips from short dramas, she thought they were "tacky". Those settings, such as "The Overlord and His Little Wife," were all popular elements in online articles more than ten years ago. But she didn't expect that now she is chasing short dramas. During the play, I still felt like I was "on top".

;

;;

;

;Stills from the online short drama "The President Loves Me Too Much". Data map

;

;She thinks this may be related to the simplicity and directness of the short play. For example, she wants to watch "The Boss's Sweet Pet". In some TV dramas, it may take a long development process to reach the plot point of "pet", but the short drama is different. It will directly use the plot scene of "pet, love hard". Presented; another example is the plot of a slap in the face. A long drama may take a long time to prepare, but a short drama may reveal the conspiracy of the vicious female supporting character in the next episode and slap the face immediately.

;

;"Instead of waiting for an hour for that one (cool) point, why don't I look at 10 (cool) points in 5 minutes. Although it looks tacky, But it’s refreshing faster.” Tan Zhifeng told Southern Weekend reporters, “What everyone needs is simple, fast and direct.”

;

;Mo Xia also thinks so. She is 28 years old and works in a public institution. She remembered a costume-themed short drama she had watched before. There was a plot where the heroine changed her face, and no one except the hero could recognize her. She felt that if this plot was placed in a long drama, there would definitely be misunderstandings that would take several episodes to complete, which would make people feel frustrated. However, in the short drama, “There are no misunderstandings, it’s just a very smooth plot, and everyone just It was fun to watch.”

;

;"I don't care what the two people in the middle have gone through, I just want to see them reconcile." Qiao Wei said. In her opinion, long dramas will always try to be logically linked, but "there will still be logical gaps." Short dramas are less concerned with logic. "(Since) it's not perfect, I might as well show more of what I want to see."

;

;"Provide us with material for dreaming"

;

;Like online articles, short dramas are also divided into "gender". "Mainly serving male audiences, the audience of "Female Channel Drama" is mainly female. Li Yu is currently mainly writing "male dramas". He has created eighty or ninety short plays, most of which have themes such as the God of War and the son-in-law. He introduced that the audience of "male video drama" is mainly between the ages of 35 and 55. Most of them work as security guards, delivery workers, online ride-hailing drivers, etc., and their educational level is generally low.

;

;Yan Peiliang, who currently mainly produces "female video dramas", said that "female video dramas" are more like romantic dramas, usually with elements such as sweet pets and sadomasochism. "Male dramas" are more delicate, and the age of the audience is relatively young, mainly between 25 and 45 years old. These women usually have a certain level of education and pay more attention to the picture, atmosphere and other factors of the short drama.

;

;But in Yan Peiliang's view, whether it is a "male video drama" or a "female video drama", most viewers will substitute themselves when watching. Female viewers may fantasize about a handsome guy pursuing them, while male viewers may assume the identity of the male protagonist and feel that they are "counterattacking" and "getting rich".

;

;He observed that unlike female audiences who have high requirements for the appearance of the male and female protagonists in "female-channel dramas", male audiences watch "male-channel dramas" ", the requirements for the male protagonist's appearance are not high, just ordinary. Too good-looking will affect their acceptance. But at the same time, they hope that the heroine will be as beautiful as possible, so that "the fantasy can be fulfilled."

;

;As a short play writer and director, Zhizhu pays more attention to creating a sense of atmosphere when filming, so that the audience can better relate to it. She is a photographer and started filming short plays in early 2022. Now her two short plays have received ratings of 6.8 and 7.2 respectively on Douban. She will work hard on lighting and composition, and create a sense of atmosphere by arranging scenes such as rain and wind. Sometimes she will also create a sense of tension through the gazes of the male and female protagonists as needed.

;

;;

;

;Stills from the online short series "Donglan Snow". Data map

;

;"Actually, everyone has a dream about love in their hearts. I think the short drama invisibly provides us with material for dreaming." Qiao Wei told Southern Weekend reporter.

;

;She always calls herself a "middle-aged girl". In reality, she has a happy small family, and her son is already in the first grade of elementary school. But she feels that "the reality is You are who you are, and you will never be the heroine in 'The Boss Falls in Love with Me', but when you watch the show, you can realize such a dream."

;

;Qian Wan is 27 years old and works in a bank. When watching short dramas, he prefers the plot of "chasing his wife in the crematorium". For example, the male protagonist originally had a "Bai Yueguang", but he abandoned the female protagonist after Bai Yueguang came back. After experiencing some things, he realized that the person he really loved was the heroine, thus starting the "crematorium" mode. She felt that this might be related to her only real love experience.

;

;That relationship was pursued by her, and it only lasted for more than ten days. The other party admitted to her during a phone call that he still liked the girl he had not pursued before. Qian Wan felt that she had been tricked by the other party, and she was unwilling and sad. At that time, she really hoped that the boy would regret it, but she sent a message to the other party at that time, but the other party did not reply.

;

;"Aren't (these) dramas just for dreaming?" Qian Wan said. Ren Dongxiao also thinks so. She is a sophomore this year. When watching short dramas, every time she sees the heroine being bullied and the CEO hero standing up to protect and take care of the heroine and slapping other people in the face, she expects it to really exist in reality. Such a person.

;

;Qiao Wei remembered watching "Tom and Jerry" when she was a child. No matter how much Tom was tortured by Jerry, he could not get enough of Jerry. This made her very happy. Peace of mind is a joy. Watching short dramas gave her a similar feeling. The villain's thoughts were always on his face. No matter how he framed the heroine, the hero would always appear at the critical moment. No matter how many twists and turns the hero and heroine went through, there was always a positive outcome. "Everything you hope will happen happens, everything you hope to see will be seen," she said.

;

;In Tan Zhifeng’s view, many short dramas will deliberately omit complicated things in real life. For example, if an 18th-tier star becomes a movie queen, the middle part should be It’s a long road, but in the short play, “you can get all the fame and achievements you want without putting in any effort”; no matter what the heroine’s conditions are or how she behaves, the CEO is devoted to her for no reason. . "Success comes so easily, and so does love." She said, "(These) things that make no sense if you think about it carefully may just be a dream created for everyone."

;

;"Maybe this kind of thing "Happiness can't be found in the elegant hall, but it doesn't matter"

;

;Li Yu currently writes mainly "small program short plays". He is 20 years old and can write two pieces a month. Three parts, each with about 100 episodes. The four short plays he wrote in the past two months are "60% similar in content", and they are all based on the same God of War theme. The protagonist may be a fish seller in this drama, but next time he will be a pig butcher; some of the key slap-in-the-face plots will take place at the old man's birthday party, and some will be at the heroine's home.

;

;Li Yu doesn't want his friends to know that he is writing a short play, for fear that they will think, "It turns out that such rubbish stuff was written by people like you." . He would feel "very ashamed" and "(the short play he wrote) has no nutrition, literary value or artistic value", but "currently they (editors and platforms) do not want to innovate and do not require taking risks", and he also needs to survive .

;

;"Short plays inherently have many similar plots. (If you) often watch short plays, you will find that many characters have similar names and cannot be distinguished at all." Many short dramas currently on the market do not have the so-called film and television language. "To put it bluntly, it is a dynamic PPT for online novels." Yan Peiliang told Southern Weekend reporters.

;

;Mo Xia said that she "can remember very few". She has watched nearly fifty short plays this year, and she can name the titles and general plots of them. No more than ten. Other short drama viewers interviewed also mentioned that it was difficult to remember which short dramas they had watched. Tan Zhifeng recalled a certain short drama he had watched before, and what he remembered more was the short drama elements of "traveling through the past, empress, queen, CEO, sweet pet, counterattack and slap in the face".

;

;"I can only say that this kind of short play is excitement itself. No matter how it is produced, it only meets some momentary needs for happiness. Maybe this kind of happiness even reaches the top of the screen. It’s not elegant, but it doesn’t matter.” Tan Zhifeng told Southern Weekend reporters. Just like herself, she is busy and stressed in real life, and she hopes to focus on watching things in her spare time that do not require the use of her brain. "You can't keep one string tight all the time."

;

;;

;

;Stills from the online short series "Abuse of Love: Mr. Lu's Newly Married Mute Wife". Data map

;

;Qiao Wei attaches great importance to the two hours of free time before going to bed. For her, "If I didn't have these two hours, I would either be a As a wife, either a mother or an employee, I have to think about how to live a better life. (But) I feel that only when these two hours belong to myself, (will I) consider whether I am happy or not. I It doesn’t matter who it is, I don’t have to work hard or think.”

;

;She feels that the short play is “quite efficient” in terms of satisfying her own needs for happiness. . She used to spend those two hours playing games where she could design her own plot, or learning to play the ukulele. Although she was happy, she still found it too mentally taxing. "The short play feels like a popping candy to me. I've finished it in one bite. I don't need to think about it. I just feel happy now. As for whether it is meaningful or not, I don't think it's important."

;

;But she also feels that if there is no short drama, it will not have much impact. Zhizhu also believes that even if there is no short drama, there will be something else, because everyone is very tired from work, and there must always be some entertainment channels for emotional release. Games, short videos, and novels can all be options. "( Short plays) are very alternative for the audience."

;

;Yan Peiliang feels that although short plays are "dispensable" for some audiences. But just like Coke, some people think it is dispensable, and there will always be people who regard it as a necessity. "Let the audience choose for themselves." For example, a breakfast shop sells steamed buns and provides side dishes. Some people buy the steamed buns and leave, while others just pick them up. Some dried radishes and pickles, "The value of our existence is that when the audience has this demand, we still have some relatively good quality pickles waiting for them."

;

; Mon, 27 Nov 2023 15:25:03 +0800 离婚跟拍火了，闲得慌还是花钱买仪式感？http://www.infzm.com/contents/261363
;;2023-11-27 15:00:00;
;

;Recently, divorce follow-up photography has become popular among young people. When they get divorced, many young people put aside the past haze and choose to follow the divorce and hold a divorce party.

;

;At the divorce party, the banner read: "This is the end of this B marriage." Blogger Sushi said, "I think marriage has a corresponding sense of ceremony, and divorce also needs it."

;

;;

;

;;(Visual China/Picture );

;

;;Photography of marriage and filming of divorce;

;

;Data shows that China’s divorce rate has increased year by year since 2003, reaching its peak in 2019 at 3.4‰. In the past two years, it has also remained above 2‰. Among them, young people aged 25-35 have become the main force in divorce.

;

;Under this trend, young people's attitudes and thoughts when facing divorce have changed greatly compared with the past. Compared with the bitterness and hatred of the older generation, divorce seems to be becoming a "peaceful thing" and a positive thing.

;

;In fact, as early as the 2010 movie "If You Are the One 2", Mango, played by Yao Chen, and Li Xiangshan, played by Sun Honglei, held a party when they separated. Divorce ceremony. Actor Ge You, as the divorce certifier, said in his speech: "Let's shake hands like acquaintances," which brought a relatively happy ending to the separation between the two.

;

;Today's young people use the method of divorce follow-up, taking photos and Vlog to record the end of one stage and the beginning of a new stage. Taking photos becomes a ritual in the divorce process. Of course, this ceremonial divorce photoshoot is completely different from the wedding photoshoot.

;

;As we all know, when taking wedding photos, the theme is to get married and the main focus is celebration. Almost every newlywed couple will wear Chinese or Western-style dresses and hire professional photo studios and photographers to record the two people as a couple cuddling with each other and being united forever in various settings such as the seaside, under the shadow of coconut trees, and in the courtyard of an ancient house. The beautiful shadow.

;

;But divorce photos are no longer carefully posed on the beach or in the shadow of coconut trees, but may be the Civil Affairs Bureau or a place where the two went shopping together, or even A certain park or tea house for daily simple photography. After photographer Song Yang accepted an order to follow up on the divorce of an old classmate, he followed his friends to several places that were memorable to them.

;

;During the process, Song Yang followed silently and did not find a special camera position to capture the scene. He only occasionally gave simple guidance to the subjects. The overall atmosphere was not heavy and similar to normal. life portraits. Song Yang said, "It's like shooting with normal friends. Everyone is calm, no conflicts, and not too close. And it's more casual, without even discussing in advance where to shoot and how to shoot."

;

;In addition to the final group photo, other divorce photos also include a photo of a girl who came to a coffee shop after the divorce and took a photo with a coffee cup with "Happy Single" written on it. . The scenes and shots are not complicated, but with this simple stroke, the divorce was brought to an end.

;

;;

;

;;(Visual China/Picture);

;

;;Why do young people want to take divorce photos?;

;

;So, why do young people want to take divorce photos when they get divorced? First of all, of course, it was because of the divorce. As this incident occurred, many comprehensive factors behind it came into play.

;

;Currently, the development of social civilization has entered a new stage. Marriage is changing from a lifelong bond in the traditional concept to a relationship in the minds of young people. Freedom of choice. The influence of traditional concepts on young people is weakening, and young people are beginning to pay more attention to their personal rights and feelings.

;

;With the change of this concept, when people face divorce, they have changed from crying, discrimination and dissuasion to equality today. Look at peace and confrontation, as well as calm and stable positive solutions, as turning points towards happiness.

;

;Zhou Xiaoyan, a psychology professor at Chongqing Normal University, believes that "the business of divorce tracking can be carried out, which is enough to see changes in society and people's tolerance and psychological tolerance." Higher. In the past, everyone generally believed that divorce was an ugly thing and was unwilling to talk about it too much. Now, divorce is regarded as an event in life, and is no longer defined by failure, but by experience."

;

;Recording the divorce process is exactly what the French anthropologist Van Gennep put forward, "There is always a transition from one stage to another in human life. , a ritual is needed in the process of transformation." Recording, sharing, and getting likes and comments, and fixing the mood, expression, time, location, etc. of the divorce in the circle of friends and social platforms is a sense of ritual.

;

;On the other hand, as a professor of sociology at Tsinghua University said, "Social media brings people who are far away", whether it is Douyin or Xiaohong Books, the impact of the online social wave is inevitable. When Generation Z people see some bloggers or peers sharing their experience in taking divorce photos, they will easily become curious about trying it. It is only human nature to follow the trend and take photos.

;

;;Will divorce photography become a large-scale business? ;

;

;So, with the interest of young people in taking divorce photos, will divorce photography become a large-scale business? At present, it is not very large-scale yet and is relatively niche.

;

;From the perspective of demand, although the divorce rate is now high and there are many divorced people, the divorced group is also divided into those who need to take divorce photos and those who do not. Of those who have this need, they are still in the minority. Therefore, the market size of divorce photos is actually relatively small.

;

;Judging from the current situation of receiving orders, many photographers receive such photo invitations on social platforms and then follow them. Some photographers with similar experience also publish relevant information through social platforms to gain customers. In reality, no dedicated docking platform or professional organization has emerged, and no large-scale promotion has occurred.

;

;However, from a business perspective, where there is demand, consumption will be created. Business opportunities often arise from scratch, from small to large. Divorce, like birth, birthday, graduation, marriage, funeral, etc., is actually a turning event in life. Compared with graduation or marriage, divorce, an equally important life event, has obviously not received enough attention and response. This is where the business opportunities for divorce services lie.

;

;In the future, with the continuous changes in concepts, it is not impossible that the end of a marriage will be taken as seriously as the beginning of a marriage. Once this emphasis on divorce is transformed into demand and consumption, corresponding divorce service projects will appear more and more like marriage services. According to media reports, Japanese divorce companies can provide services such as divorce ceremonies and divorce travel, and many divorced couples have experienced corresponding services.

;

;Of course, divorce photography also involves the photographer getting to know the emotions and privacy of both clients. This also requires practitioners to have certain legal knowledge and be able to Avoid during operation. But as the other side of marriage, relevant practitioners can pay attention to divorce-related products and services. It may not necessarily be an explosive growth business, but as the second growth curve, it may not be an effective supplement to regular business.

; Mon, 27 Nov 2023 15:25:03 +0800 一根78元的“考试专用”跳绳背后：企业为何连年中标应严肃调查丨快评http://www.infzm.com/contents/261375
;;2023-11-27 14:00:00;
;

;How much does a skipping rope cost? On e-commerce platforms, ordinary racing skipping ropes from many well-known sports brands only cost a dozen yuan, and even ones with counting functions can be bought for thirty or forty yuan. However, there are also some skipping ropes marked "Exclusively for the High School Entrance Examination in ** City" that are expensive. Xinhua News Agency recently reported that a special skipping rope designated by the Hangzhou Education Department for the high school entrance examination sells for as much as 78 yuan a piece.

;

;According to Xinhua News Agency, for more than ten years, Hangzhou's high school entrance examination sports rope skipping projects have been using "Hengyou" brand skipping ropes. In order to familiarize children with the test ropes in advance, many schools and teachers explicitly or implicitly allow students to use "Hengyou" brand skipping ropes for practice. The brand's skipping ropes sell for 78 yuan for the regular model, and more than 140 yuan for the one with Bluetooth counting function. Even though the price is much higher than other brands, parents still have to pay the bill.

;

;It is designated by the local education department as a test-only device. In order to achieve good results in the exam, students have to use it for daily practice. This strategy has made "Hengyou" brand rope skipping a lot of money in Hangzhou. According to the agent of this brand of skipping ropes in Zhejiang, they sell more than 100,000 skipping ropes in Zhejiang a year, and more than 70% of their users are primary and secondary school students. In the past few years, Hangzhou had almost 100,000 primary and secondary school students (according to the Hangzhou National Economic and Social Development Statistical Bulletin, there were 681,000 primary school students and 264,000 junior high school students in Hangzhou in 2021), which shows its penetration rate. high. Calculated based on the profit of 70 yuan per ordinary skipping rope (industry sources revealed that the cost of ordinary skipping ropes is less than 8 yuan each, and the cost of those with counting functions is less than 20 yuan), the brand has a stable profit of more than 7 million yuan in Hangzhou every year.

;

;How did the "Hengyou" skipping rope become exclusive for the Hangzhou High School Entrance Examination? According to an interview with Xinhua News Agency, the agent of the brand's skipping rope in Zhejiang said that since entering the Zhejiang market in 2011, the "Hengyou" skipping rope has been used for the Hangzhou High School Entrance Examination Sports Examination Rope. The deputy director of the Hangzhou Municipal Education Examination Institute, who is responsible for purchasing sports equipment for the Hangzhou High School Entrance Examination, said that since 2011, the education department has "rented and used" high school entrance examination sports equipment produced by this brand manufacturer. Starting from 2017, the Education Examination Agency has used public bidding to select sports equipment for the high school entrance examination. However, this company still wins the bid every year, and the annual rental fee is 8.9 million yuan. A document from the Zhejiang Provincial Government Procurement Network shows that in 2019, the Hangzhou Education Examination Institute plans to use the "single source" procurement method to lease sports equipment of this brand for the high school entrance examination.

;

;As soon as it entered the Zhejiang market, it became the exclusive skipping rope for high school entrance examination sports in Hangzhou City. It has been used exclusively for more than ten years. The "open bidding" of the education department turned out to be "single source procurement", excluding other brands of skipping ropes on the grounds of so-called "continuity of use, integrity of the examination system, and specificity of the software management platform." It is inevitable that people will have doubts. Who is this company? Who is its actual controller? What is so special about it that it deserves the favor of the Hangzhou Education Department?

;

;This situation of "exam-only" skipping ropes that are much higher than the market price does not only exist in Hangzhou. Search results on the e-commerce platform show that the Shanghai high school entrance examination-specific technical skipping rope costs 158 yuan each, and the Guiyang "examination room same style timing and counting online model" skipping rope costs 179 yuan each.

;

;Why must I use a specific brand of skipping rope for the rope skipping test? Especially according to students and teachers, this skipping rope is not suitable for primary and secondary school students. In fact, every skipping rope that meets national standards should be used for exams. For physical education exams, you can purchase a variety of skipping ropes from different brands, allowing students to choose freely. You might even consider asking students to bring their own jump ropes for exams. As for the automatic counting function that improves efficiency, if you are worried about inaccurate counting of students’ own skipping ropes, other methods can be used to solve the problem. With current technology, automatic counting can be achieved through video surveillance.

;

;In the past few years, some schools have frequently "cooperated" with businesses to sell designated teaching aids to students. Some schools even required students to purchase tablets worth several thousand yuan in the name of "information-based teaching." computer. To this end, the Ministry of Education and other departments have issued a document specifically requiring that "students and parents shall not be forced or hinted to purchase designated teaching aid software or materials." But the examination, as a baton, will still play an obvious guiding role. As we all know, China’s education is seriously involution and everything is exam-oriented. As long as it is labeled "exam-only", no matter how expensive it is, parents will buy it. This gives education departments and schools a lot of invisible power. When the education department labels a certain brand's products as "exam-only", it is equivalent to endorsing it and giving it a great advantage in market competition. This advantage comes from administrative designation, which is essentially an administrative monopoly or rent-seeking behavior.

;

;So, is there really nothing behind the 78-yuan "exclusively for high school entrance examination" skipping rope? This is something that relevant departments should find out clearly. More importantly, it breaks the status quo of only using certain equipment for exams and gives students more choices. Only in this way can normal market competition be promoted, students and parents will be spared from becoming leeks, and students can also use better products.

; Mon, 27 Nov 2023 14:25:04 +0800 “中国乞讨者泰国被捕”背后：残酷的人口贩运链http://www.infzm.com/contents/261387

;

;Facial disfigurement, physical disabilities... In recent days, several Chinese beggars have appeared on the streets of Bangkok. Putting Thailand at the forefront of public opinion has also launched a new round of crackdowns on illegal begging.

;

;On November 22, 2023, Aung Munna, deputy director of the Bangkok Metropolitan Police Department in Thailand, announced at a press conference that from November 10 to 20, the Bangkok police arrested six Chinese beggars. , and all six of them had varying degrees of disfigurement.

;

;Based on the physical conditions, confessions and partial investigation results of the six beggars when they were arrested, the Thai police suspected that these beggars may be victims of human trafficking.

;

;Begging is prohibited in Thailand, but begging on the streets has always existed. Data from the Thai Ministry of Social Development and Human Security show that from 2016 to the present, 7,151 beggars have been found in Thailand, including 2,473 foreign beggars, most of whom are Cambodians and Burmese, and 68 are Chinese citizens.

;

;Some of the beggars wandering the streets of Thailand are forced to beg because of human trafficking. According to the Thai charity Der Spiegel Foundation, there are at least 1,000 trafficked child beggars in Thailand. The "Global Trafficking in Persons Report" released by the United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime also pointed out that of the 36,488 victims of human trafficking detected in 2020, 0.7% were for exploitative begging.

;

;On November 22, the spokesperson of the Chinese Embassy in Thailand responded, “The Embassy has taken note of the relevant reports and has sent consular officials to conduct consular visits to the parties. China has always required Chinese citizens coming to Thailand to abide by Thai laws. , respect local customs, and also attach importance to safeguarding their legitimate rights and interests. We believe that the relevant departments of the Thai government and the police will find out the truth as soon as possible and handle it appropriately in accordance with the law."

;

;Who is behind the scenes?

;

;The arrest of a Chinese beggar was inseparable from the report of Thai Internet celebrity Guntouch Pongpaiboonwet.

;

;Guntouch is active on Facebook. He has long been concerned about social issues in Thailand and has 730,000 fans. On November 19, 2023, Guntouch learned that a woman wearing a student uniform and a deformed face was begging in the Pin Klao area of ​​Bangkok. He suspected that international human trafficking might be involved, so he reported it to the police.

;

;On the same day, the Thai police arrested the female beggar. When she was arrested, she was carrying a backpack, a chair, a money box and a key card.

;

;A Thai vendor who has been operating a store in a shopping mall for more than ten years told the police that she only started to find beggars wearing student uniforms begging nearby this year. "The arrested Chinese beggars are not alone. She appears early in the morning with other beggars and doesn't leave until evening."

;

;Media reports stated that the female beggar told the police that she went to Thailand to beg on November 10. She said that she was divorced and had two sons to raise.

;

;After the woman was arrested, another Chinese woman claimed to be the beggar's translator and came to the police station to release her on bail, but was refused by the Thai police.

;

;The woman is not the only illegal beggar arrested by Thai police.

;

;As of November 20, Thai police arrested a total of six Chinese beggars in Bangkok. According to the Thai Immigration Bureau, the six beggars entered Thailand on different flights from mainland China, Hong Kong, Malaysia and Laos.

;

;As the investigation continues, more details are emerging.

;

;Thailand police investigation found that these beggars began to enter Thailand on tourist visas in June, and one of them was applying for a private university in northern Thailand. If your tourist visa is converted to a student visa, you will be able to extend your stay in Thailand.

;

;According to reports, beggars daily beg in crowded shopping malls and tourist attractions, earning about 10,000 baht (approximately RMB 2,000) per person per day. The police investigated the bank account of one of the women and found that the monthly flow was as high as 2 million baht (approximately RMB 400,000).

;

;According to comprehensive media reports, the six arrested beggars were around 40 years old, and all had facial scars and disabilities in their limbs. One of the beggars told the police that his facial injuries and hand disabilities were old childhood injuries caused by the explosion of flammable items, while the others refused to provide relevant information.

;

;In addition, there are inextricably linked relationships between these beggars. Thai police found that two of the beggars lived in the Wang Thonglang area, and the rest lived in different hotels in Bangkok. This is inconsistent with the previous arrest of a woman who said she had no fixed abode. Meanwhile, some beggars share the same Thai translation.

;

;The Thai police suspect that these beggars may be victims of international human trafficking, and that there may be Thai support behind the begging gang.

;

;Currently, one beggar has been deported from Thailand, and the remaining beggars are still detained at the Immigration Bureau. Major General Panta, deputy director of the Thai Immigration Department, said that the investigation into the gang involved is being expanded.

;

;At the same time, Thailand’s campaign against illegal begging continues to deepen. Media reports said that Thai police arrested four more beggars in Bangkok, from Laos and Cambodia.

;

;Countries of origin, destination and transit of human trafficking

;

;Begging is illegal in Thailand. As early as 2016, Thailand introduced the "Begging Control Law" in an attempt to eliminate illegal beggars on the streets.

;

;According to this law, foreign beggars who beg in Thailand will be deported, while domestic beggars will be forced to receive vocational training or be sent to reception centers. Those who attempt to profit from organizing street begging will face up to three years in prison and/or a fine of up to 30,000 baht.

;

;At the same time, in order to combat street begging, Thailand has carried out many street cleaning operations in recent years. According to reports, in May 2023, the Pattaya police in Thailand arrested 37 Cambodian beggars, including 19 adults and 18 children.

;

;According to Thai officials, strict measures against street begging are to prevent illegal begging from breeding many criminal problems such as human trafficking and child labor.

;

;However, in fact, Thailand, known as the "Land of Smiles", has long been plagued by the dark trade of human trafficking.

;

;In 2015, the U.S. State Department released the "Trafficking in Persons Report", which ranked Thailand as the third lowest ranking, which means that the Thai government did not fully comply with the minimum standards in responding to and eliminating human trafficking, and No significant effort was made. Meanwhile, the U.S. State Department noted that Thailand is a source, destination and transit country for men, women and children subject to forced labor and sex trafficking.

;

;Thailand is located in the center of Southeast Asia and is a destination for illegal immigrants from many neighboring countries seeking high-paying jobs. The United Nations International Organization for Migration estimates that there are nearly 5 million immigrants in Thailand, of which about 1 million to 2.5 million do not have legal immigration status. Lacking legal protection, these illegal immigrants are extremely vulnerable to work exploitation, human smuggling and trafficking, and transnational crime.

;

;Meanwhile, the "Golden Triangle" connecting Thailand, Myanmar and Laos has been a hotbed of illegal activity, with Thailand a convenient location for traffickers to transport victims to other countries. Reports indicate that sex trafficking victims from Bangladesh, Pakistan, Vietnam and North Korea transit through Thailand to Western Europe, Singapore, Russia and the United States.

;

;It is also difficult for the Thai people themselves to escape the nightmare of human trafficking.

;

;It is reported that as of July 2020, more than 120,000 Thais are still working abroad. "Many Thais prefer to seek easier but illegal jobs abroad, which makes them easy targets for human traffickers and easy to be exploited by unscrupulous employers," said Samann, a senior fellow at the Institute of Asia Studies at Chulalongkorn University in Thailand.

;

;The Thomson Reuters Foundation estimates that at least 522 Thai workers died in South Korea from 2015 to 2022, about 84% of whom were illegal immigrants.

;

;In order to change the status quo, in 2018, the Thai police teamed up with social workers and non-governmental organizations to set up a special working group to combat human trafficking. At the same time, the Thai government is increasing its financial budget every year. In 2022, the Thai government will allocate 440 million baht to prevent and combat human trafficking.

;

;Judging from official data, the problem of human trafficking in Thailand seems to have improved.

;

;In June 2023, the U.S. State Department released the latest version of the "Trafficking in Persons Report", and Thailand's ranking rose to the second level. This is the second consecutive year that Thailand has ranked second. Thailand's Minister of Social Development and Human Security Waravutt noted that Thailand has been committed to improving to Level 1.

;

;Data show that in 2022, the Thai government investigated 253 cases of human trafficking and identified 444 victims of human trafficking. The vast majority of these 444 victims are from Thailand (344) and ASEAN countries such as Laos, Myanmar, and Indonesia. Another 11 are from China, Uganda, Tanzania, Uzbekistan, Kenya, and other countries.

;

;However, the data released by the Thai government may be just the tip of the iceberg.

;

;The U.S. State Department pointed out in the 2023 "Human Trafficking Report" that fraud companies located in Cambodia, Laos, Myanmar and the Philippines often use Thailand as a transit country to lure fraudsters.

;

;Myawaddy, located on the border of Thailand and Myanmar, is one of the main gathering places for fraud parks, across the river from Mae Sot, Thailand. Mechel Moore, CEO of the Mae Sot Anti-Human Trafficking NGO, told reporters that since August 2022, the organization has helped at least 452 victims of human trafficking.

;

;It is worth mentioning that behind human trafficking in Thailand, there are often government officials, who facilitate human trafficking by accepting bribes. In 2022 alone, 35 government officials were investigated by the Thai government for their involvement in human trafficking.
